title: The Great Elm
medium: watercolor on five pieces of paper glued together
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Charles E. Burchfield [1893-1967], West Seneca, NY; Frank K. M. Rehn, Inc., New York, NY, by May 1942 until 1944 [1]; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA [2]; their gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1944 [3].

Notes:
[1]. The work is credited to the Rehn Gallery in the May 1942 issue of "American Artist" (illustrated, p. 7.) It was no. 23 in "Painting in the United States" held at Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October-December 1944 (illustrated, plate 85.) The watercolor was purchased by Mr. and Mrs. Beal from the exhibition for $2,000, as a gift to Carnegie Institute.
[2]. Mr. Rehn acknowledged receipt of Mrs. Beal's payment on December 6, 1944 (see original receipt and copies of correspondence in curatorial file.) See also "The Beal Collection of American Art," Carnegie Museum of Art, 1994, pages 78-79. 
[3]. The watercolor was accessioned on November 29, 1944.

creator.death_place: West Seneca (Erie county, New York state, United States)
